This line forms the bottom edge of the rectangular prism. 5. **Create a line_2 in loop_1.** Set the start point as [0.75, 0.0] and the end point as [0.75, 0.75]. This line forms the right edge of the rectangular prism. 6. **Create a line_3 in loop_1.** Set the start point as [0.75, 0.75] and the end point as [0.0, 0.75]. This line forms the top edge of the rectangular prism. 7. **Create a line_4 in loop_1.** Set the start point as [0.0, 0.75] and the end point as [0.0, 0.0]. This line forms the left edge of the rectangular prism, creating a closed loop. 8. **Close the sketch.** This forms the 2D sketch for the rectangular prism. 9. **Scale the 2D sketch** by a factor of 0.75, using the sketch scale property. 10. **Transfer the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch** using the given coordinate system, including euler angles and translation vector. 11. **Extrude the 2D sketch to generate a 3D model** with an extrusion depth of 0 towards the normal and a depth of 0 opposite the normal. The sketch scale should be 0.75, and the operation should be set as a new solid body. The dimensions for this part are length: 0.75, width: 0.75, and height: 0.75. (Note: The original JSON provided has a slight discrepancy in the height value, as stated in the description. I chose to maintain the height consistent with the coordinates provided in the loops.)</description>
